title: How to Make Gluten Free Peppermint Cream Puffs

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 300 degrees Fahrenheit (148.9 degrees Celsius).
In a medium sized mixing bowl, beat the egg whites and cream of tartar on high speed.
steps.description: Do this until it has thickened. It will be when stiff peaks form.

steps.headline: In a separate bowl, mix the egg yolks, cream cheese and sweetener.
Fold the yolk mixture carefully into the whites.
Spoon the batter into the cupcake pans.
steps.description: Base the size of your cupcake pans on the size of the desired cake pans.

steps.headline: Let them cool somewhat.
steps.description: While they are still warm, separate the puff from the pans.

steps.headline: In another mixing bowl, whip together some heavy white cream, the sweetener, peppermint extract and some food coloring.
Carefully, pull the puffs apart (or slice them).
Spoon the whipped cream into the resulting shell.
Put the top shell on the puff and refrigerate your cream puffs until needed.

text: Steps Preheat your oven to 300 degrees Fahrenheit (148.9 degrees Celsius).  Grease your cupcake pans.  In a medium sized mixing bowl, beat the egg whites and cream of tartar on high speed. Do this until it has thickened. It will be when stiff peaks form. In a separate bowl, mix the egg yolks, cream cheese and sweetener.  Fold the yolk mixture carefully into the whites.  Spoon the batter into the cupcake pans. Base the size of your cupcake pans on the size of the desired cake pans. Bake for thirty minutes.  Let them cool somewhat. While they are still warm, separate the puff from the pans. In another mixing bowl, whip together some heavy white cream, the sweetener, peppermint extract and some food coloring. Do this for about 4 minutes. Assemble the Cream Puffs Carefully, pull the puffs apart (or slice them).  Spoon the whipped cream into the resulting shell.  Put the top shell on the puff and refrigerate your cream puffs until needed.
